lexUnit.name: smell.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a quality in something that is perceived by this faculty

sentence.text: The fire from which the smoke came was not far from the hut door and the air was rank with the smell of pelts drying .
The cottage was redolent with the zesty smell of lemon overlaying the more familiar tang of polish , wine and wood smoke .
She laughed up at him , with the oily smell of the sheepskins rising about her ; her teeth showed yellow , like an animal 's .
I remember it as horrible , with a smell of cold cabbage seeming to come from the upholstery .
Claudia came awake slowly , the smell of coffee tantalising her nostrils .
Lobsters , crabs , crawfish , scallops , oysters and turbots lay in baskets , and the smell of the salt combining with the heat of the stoves made the kitchen almost unendurable , even for Auguste .
He was applying a match to some kind of heater , and from a small counter in the far corner there was a distinct smell of coffee pervading the atmosphere .
Behind the long counter there were hams hanging , the smell of them adding to the already aromatic air of the place .
He rolls off me and passes out on the pillow , the smell of his drunkenness lingering like something live .
I burst out of the water to inhale the smell of the warm buried desert careering across the surface of the pool .
I was hungry but had to wait while he fiddled with a saucepan and then made me endure the smell of the meat coming from it .
Soon pieces of meat were being roasted right around the fire , and the air was thick with the smell of charred flesh and singeing fur .
She enjoyed the quiet gloom of the shippon , the sweet smell of hay , and the cows themselves , gentle creatures except for the sometimes awkward Primrose .
Jane recalled that evil spirits were said to be frightened off by the smell of burning rue .
The smell of gunpowder filled his nostrils .
The priest had gone , but he had left the smell of scented oils behind him .
` I remember the smell of this house .
The smell of the smoke drifted back towards Cassie across the garden .
The woman 's face twitches like a tramp 's to the smell of soup .
Around the boarded-up house the sweet smell of rotting vegetables hung in the air .
To Clare , his milky warm smell was like that of a newborn baby .
` I do n't like to tell people , " she laughs , ` but I can recognise them by their smell .
Thérèse hated their smell .
It was cold inside but the friar was pleased that it had lost its musty smell .
The house was always cold , full of stale animal smells and decorated with grotesque knick-knacks made from deer hooves or ram 's horns which gave her nightmares .
Amazing cooking smells were drifting from the kitchen .
She had not been absent from her home for long enough to have forgotten her own house smell .
She seemed abnormally sensitive to the smoke smells and her stomach was rolling uncomfortably .
To add to her miserable state a bleak wind had got up , bringing with it a sweet tangy yeast smell that made her stomach roll and cry out .
The air had a peculiar smell to it , she noted , as she made her way down the street towards the front and the spot where her dad tied up his boat .
Outside the smell from the brewery hung over the town , stifling as a warm pillow , making it difficult to breathe .
There was never any shortage of cats in the neighbourhood ; they too added their smell to the back gardens .
Every Londoner seemed to be out of doors : the stall-holders were busy making up for lost trade and the air was thick with savoury smells from taverns and cookshops .
In Norway in winter the smell of freshly baked bread , and the warmth from the containers , are great attractions , and visitors seem to congregate around the bakery like bees around a honey pot .
You go into a café where the sight and smell of freshly baked Danish pastries hits you squarely in the face as you walk through the door .
The air was thick with sawdust and the sweet smell of freshly cut wood .
The rain had stopped and the air was filled with the sweet smell of freshly washed earth .
Coming home from school on a Friday afternoon , the delicious smell emanating from our kitchen permeated the entire tenement .
There was a delicious smell wafting from a pink hyacinth which was growing in a glass on the table at his side .
